name: La Claire Fontaine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: La Roche is a great little town for a few days visit and this hotel, about 4 mins drive out of town, has a wonderful location on the banks of The Semois. It has extensive grounds leading right down to the riverside, with some parts being made up from carefully tended gardens.
reviews.title: Great setting but Rooms are a little lacking

reviews.text: The buildings are an aggregation of an original house, plus several extensions, some in wood, others glass and so on. This results in a rather strange shape for many bedrooms and suites, with oddly shaped thin bathrooms, separate loos and more. The furnishing is clean enough, but seems like its from another age, or to be more accurate, several ages - somewhere between the 1930s and the 1980s - all mixed together.
reviews.title: La Claire Fontaine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a restaurant for a simple breakfast, and another for dinner, which while ok is nothing special and is not cheap. There is better food to be had up in town in the numerous brasseries and cafes.
reviews.title: Quirky but not unpleasant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is good off road parking in the quiet car park and free Internet, but coverage is limited to places near the hall.
reviews.title: Tired

reviews.text: I have been staying here for short stops, while en route, for over 14 years now. The place hardly changes at all, with the same very quiet family in evidence as owners. Don't expect anything more than a polite hello or goodbye.
reviews.title: Lovely stay for a family holiday

aka: La Claire Fontaine La Roche-En-Ardenne, Belgium - The Ardennes
